Title: Sinai Arabic 440. Lives of Saints, Martyrdoms, Mimars, Commentaries, Apophthegmata and Theological Treatises : manuscript, 1251. St. Catherine's Monastery, Sinai, Egypt
Author: Cyril, Saint, Bishop of Jerusalem, approximately 315-386|~|John Chrysostom, Saint, -407|~|Dionysius, the Areopagite, Saint, active 1st century
Contents note: Codex containing 27 miscellaneous Lives of Saints, Martyrdoms, Mimars, Commentaries, Apophthegmata and Theological Treatises by many Fathers including Saints Cyril Bishop of Jerusalem, John Chrysostom, Stephen, Dionysius, Arsenius and others ; Martyrdom of the Apostles Peter and Paul, Athanasius of the city of Qulzum, Quiricus and Julitta his mother, Agathangelus, Sidarius, Sophia, and her three daugthers, Mamas, Panteleemon, Theodore the General, Theon and his three brothers, Procopius, Christina, Ignatius, Ametharius and his mother, Cyril and John the Miracle-Maker with the three virgins and their mother, Ashmunith known as Mary the Maccabean and her seven children, and Eusebius ’story of the Martyrdom of the Maccabeans are also included in text

Title: Sinai Arabic 447. Varia : manuscript, [13th c.]. St. Catherine's Monastery, Sinai, Egypt
AltTitle.uniform: John Chrysostom, Saint, -407. Homilies on Genesis
Author: John Chrysostom, Saint, -407|~|Ephraem, Syrus, Saint, 303-373|~|Abū Qurrah, Thāwdhūrus, approximately 750-825|~|Dionysius, the Areopagite, Saint, active 1st century
Contents note: Commentary on the Book of Genesis by St. John Chrysostom. Epistle of Ephraem the Syrian to John the Monk. Mimars and addresses by St. Ephraem, St. Theodore Bishop of Harran, Erotheus (Hierotheus) the Master, St. Dionysius the Areopagite and St. John Chrysostom. Stories of Joseph, of St. Paul and the demon, of St. Gerasimus by Qumadus of Bisan and of St. Theodosius. Treatise explaining how the tower of Babylon was built. Apocalypse. Epistles of Peter, John, Juda and Jacob. A prayer for the Caliph al-Ma’mūn by Abu Qurra Bishop of Harran

Contents note: Mimars selected from SS. Andrew of Cyprus, John Chrysostom, John Damascene, Epiphanius, Gregory the Theologian and Athanasius. Martyrdom of SS. Longinus the Centurion, Artemius, Jacob the Persian, Ignatius and Febronia of Nisibis. Hymn by St. Luke companion of St. Paul, encomium by St. Arcadius Archbishop of Cyprus. A commentary on the Life of St. John Damascene. An elegy sent by St. Dionysius to St. Timotheus on the occasion of the martyrdom of SS. Peter and Paul
